str2: (a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
Much, many; often.
To number, count. From arithmos; to enumerate or count.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
And, even, also, namely.
A tribe or race of people. From phuo; an offshoot, i.e. Race or clan.
And, even, also, namely.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
And, even, also, namely.
The tongue; by implication, a language.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.
And, even, also, namely.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(originally: a little lamb, but diminutive force was lost), a lamb. Diminutive from aren; a lambkin.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: From peri and ballo; to throw all around, i.e. Invest.
White, bright, brilliant. From luke; white.
A long robe, worn by the upper classes in the East. From stello; equipment, i.e., a 'stole' or long-fitting gown.
And, even, also, namely.
A palm tree, the date-palm. Of uncertain derivation; a palm-tree.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A hand.
